text.*:
This is a lists of years in animation.

Contents

  • 1 1800 to 1900
  • 2 Before 1960
  • 3 1960s
  • 4 1970s
  • 5 1980s
  • 6 1990s
  • 7 2000s
  • 8 2010s
  • 9 2020s
  • 10 See also

1800 to 1900[edit]

  • Before 1900 in animation

Before 1960[edit]

  • 1914 – Gertie the Dinosaur, one of the earliest animated films to feature a dinosaur, is released
  • 1919 – Felix the Cat, one of animation's earliest stars, appears in his first cartoon Feline Follies
  • 1923 – Walt Disney Animation Studios is founded
  • 1928 – Walt Disney's Steamboat Willie starring Mickey Mouse and Minnie Mouse becomes the first ever synchronized cartoon with sound
  • 1930 – Betty Boop stars in her first official, yet original appearance in Dizzy Dishes, and Warner Bros. launch its cartoon division releasing their iconic series of cartoons Looney Tunes
  • 1932 – Flowers and Trees becomes the first colour cartoon and wins the very first Oscar for Best Animated Short Film; Goofy (original name Dippy Dawg) makes his debut in Mickey's Revue
  • 1933 – Popeye makes his first screen debut alongside Betty Boop in Popeye the Sailor
  • 1934 – Donald Duck makes his official debut in Disney cartoon The Wise Little Hen
  • 1935 – Merrie Melodies cartoon I Haven't Got a Hat introduces the first major Looney Tune Porky Pig
  • 1937 – The release of the world's very first ever full-length animated feature film Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs; Porky's Duck Hunt, a Looney Tunes short, introduces Daffy Duck
  • 1939 – Release of Gulliver's Travels
  • 1940 – The Tom and Jerry series debuts; Knock Knock, featuring Andy Panda, see the first appearance of Woody Woodpecker; Looney Tunes cartoon A Wild Hare stars Bugs Bunny, who goes on to be the most famous Looney Tune of them all; Releases of Disney's second feature-length animated film Pinocchio, three years on from the release of Snow White, and third film Fantasia which stars Mickey Mouse in his first feature film appearance.
  • 1941 – Releases of Dumbo, and Mr. Bug Goes to Town
  • 1942 – Release of Bambi, Mouse of Tomorrow marks the first screen appearance of Mighty Mouse
  • 1945 – Casper the Friendly Ghost makes his first screen appearance in The Friendly Ghost
  • 1948 – Oscar winning Looney Tunes cartoon Tweety Pie features Sylvester and Tweety pairing up together for the first time, becoming one of the memorable rivalries in Looney Tunes history
  • 1949 – Mr. Magoo makes his debut in The Ragtime Bear and Crusader Rabbit becomes the first made for television animated series; Looney Tunes Wile E. Coyote and the Road Runner debut in their first Looney Tunes cartoon Fast and Furry-ous
  • 1950 – Releases of Cinderella and Gerald McBoing-Boing
  • 1951 – Release of Alice in Wonderland
  • 1953 – Release of Peter Pan
  • 1955 – Releases of Lady and the Tramp, becoming the first animated film to be filmed in CinemaScope, and Looney Tunes cartoon Speedy Gonzales, which introduces the latest Looney Tunes character of the same name
  • 1957 – The release of the critically acclaimed Looney Tunes cartoon What's Opera, Doc?; Hanna-Barbera is founded, followed by the first broadcast of its first show The Ruff and Reddy Show, along with The Woody Woodpecker Show
  • 1958 – Alvin and the Chipmunks make their debut appearance with the release of their classic Christmas song The Chipmunk Song (Christmas Don't Be Late) along with the first broadcast of The Huckleberry Hound Show
  • 1959 – Release of Sleeping Beauty and first broadcasts of The Quick Draw McGraw Show and Rocky and His Friends

1960s[edit]

  • 1960 – The Flintstones
  • 1961 – One Hundred and One Dalmatians, The Yogi Bear Show, The Alvin Show, Top Cat
  • 1962 – The Jetsons, Gay Purr-ee, The Hanna-Barbera New Cartoon Series
  • 1963 – Astro Boy (the first ever anime television series), The Sword in the Stone, The Magilla Gorilla Show
  • 1964 – The Pink Phink (the first ever Pink Panther cartoon), Johnny Quest, Underdog, Stingray, Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer
  • 1965 – Thunderbirds, The Magic Roundabout, Atom Ant, Secret Squirrel, A Charlie Brown Christmas (the first animated Peanuts TV special)
  • 1966 – Space Ghost, Batfink, Camberwick Green, How the Grinch Stole Christmas!
  • 1967 – The Jungle Book, George of the Jungle, Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons, Spider-Man
  • 1968 – Release of Yellow Submarine, Wacky Races, Joe 90, The Archie Show
  • 1969 – Scooby-Doo, Where Are You!, Dastardly and Muttley in Their Flying Machines, The Perils of Penelope Pitstop, The Pink Panther Show, Nu, pogodi!, Clangers, Hey, Hey, Hey, It's Fat Albert, Frosty the Snowman; The Archies release Sugar Sugar

1970s[edit]

  • 1970 – The Aristocats, Josie and the Pussycats
  • 1971 – Mr. Benn, Here Comes Peter Cottontail, Help!... It's the Hair Bear Bunch!, The Cat in the Hat
  • 1972 – Fritz the Cat (marking the launch of adult animation) Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids; Aardman is founded; the 1st Annie Awards are awarded
  • 1973 – The Wombles, Heavy Traffic, Robin Hood, Charlotte's Web, Dr. Seuss on the Loose, The Wombles, Yogi's Gang
  • 1974 – Roobarb, Hong Kong Phooey, Bagpuss
  • 1975 – Paddington, Hedgehog in the Fog, Coonskin, The Great Grape Ape Show, Bod, Ivor the Engine
  • 1976 – Dynomutt, Dog Wonder, Chorlton and the Wheelies, Jamie and the Magic Torch, Noah and Nelly in... SkylArk; Cosgrove Hall Films is founded
  • 1977 – The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh, The Rescuers, Wizards, The Hobbit, Baggy Pants and the Nitwits, Captain Caveman and the Teen Angels, Laff-A-Lympics and The Flumps
  • 1978 – Watership Down, The Lord of the Rings
  • 1979 – Tale of Tales, Doraemon

1980s[edit]

  • 1980 – The Amazing Adventures of Morph; Warner Bros. Animation is founded
  • 1981 – The Smurfs, Postman Pat, The Fox and the Hound, Willo the Wisp, Danger Mouse, Dogtanian and the Three Muskehounds
  • 1982 – The Snowman, SuperTed, The Secret of NIMH
  • 1983 – He-Man and the Masters of the Universe, G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero, Alvin and the Chipmunks, The Wind in the Willows, Inspector Gadget, The Charlie Brown and Snoopy Show, Henry's Cat, Bananaman
  • 1984 – The Transformers, The Family-Ness, Heathcliff, Voltron, Thomas the Tank Engine and Friends, The Trap Door, Rupert and the Frog Song, Muppet Babies; Disney Television Animation is founded
  • 1985 – The Raccoons, ThunderCats, Disney's Adventures of the Gummi Bears, M.A.S.K., Jem, The Black Cauldron, Care Bears, The Wuzzles; Studio Ghibli is founded
  • 1986 – An American Tail, The Great Mouse Detective, The Real Ghostbusters, Dragon Ball, The Raggy Dolls, Castle in the Sky, Pingu; Pixar is founded, along with its first short film Luxo Jr.
  • 1987 – Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Fireman Sam, DuckTales
  • 1988 – Who Framed Roger Rabbit, My Neighbour Totoro, Count Duckula, Akira, Grave of the Fireflies, Tin Toy, Oliver and Company, The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh, A Pup Named Scooby-Doo, Garfield and Friends, The Land Before Time
  • 1989 – The Simpsons, The Little Mermaid (starting off the Disney Renaissance), Wallace and Gromit, The BFG, Beetlejuice, All Dogs Go to Heaven, Muzzy, Kiki's Delivery Service, Chip 'n Dale: Rescue Rangers

1990s[edit]

  • 1990 – Creature Comforts, Tiny Toon Adventures, TaleSpin, Captain Planet and the Planeteers, Bobby's World; Nickelodeon Animation Studio is founded
  • 1991 – Beauty and the Beast, Doug, Rugrats, Ren and Stimpy, Father Christmas, Super Mario World, Darkwing Duck, The Adventures of Tintin, Rupert, Spider!, Only Yesterday, Aeon Flux
  • 1992 – Batman: The Animated Series, Sailor Moon, Aladdin, The World of Peter Rabbit and Friends, X-Men, Crayon Shin-Chan, Porco Rosso; Cartoon Network is launched
  • 1993 – The Nightmare Before Christmas, Animaniacs, Beavis and Butt-head, Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog, 2 Stupid Dogs, Rocko's Modern Life, Sonic the Hedgehog, Biker Mice From Mars, VeggieTales
  • 1994 – The Lion King, Spider-Man, Magic Adventures of Mumfie, Pom Poko, The Tick, Gargoyles, Space Ghost Coast to Coast, The Magic School Bus, Aaahh!!! Real Monsters; DreamWorks Animation is founded
  • 1995 – Toy Story, The What A Cartoon Show, Pocahontas, Timon & Pumbaa, Whisper of the Heart, The Mask: Animated Series, Freakazoid!, Pinky and the Brain
  • 1996 – Dexter's Laboratory, Hey Arnold!, James and the Giant Peach, Blue's Clues, Space Jam, Arthur, KaBlam!, The Hunchback of Notre Dame, Jungle Cubs, Superman: The Animated Series
  • 1997 – South Park, Pokémon, Princess Mononoke, I Am Weasel, Johnny Bravo, Hercules, Cow and Chicken, The Angry Beavers, Cats Don't Dance, Daria, Men in Black: The Series, Geri's Game, King of the Hill, Caillou, Recess, Anastasia
  • 1998 – The Powerpuff Girls, A Bug's Life, Antz, Oh Yeah! Cartoons, The Wild Thornberrys, Mulan, The Prince of Egypt, CatDog, Bob and Margaret, The First Snow of Winter, Bob the Builder
  • 1999 – The Iron Giant, SpongeBob SquarePants, Family Guy, Futurama, South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut, Tarzan, Digimon: Digital Monsters, Redwall, Toy Story 2, Maisy, Ed, Edd 'n Eddy, Batman Beyond, Mona the Vampire, Olive the Other Reindeer, Oggy and the Cockroaches, Robbie the Reindeer, My Neighbours the Yamadas, Courage the Cowardly Dog, Rocket Power, Mike, Lu and Og

2000s[edit]

  • 2000 – Happy Tree Friends, Chicken Run, Dora the Explorer, Aqua Teen Hunger Force, Dinosaur, Static Shock, As Told By Ginger, Teacher's Pet, Harvey Birdman: Attorney at Law, Jackie Chan Adventures, The Emperor's New Groove, For the Birds, Sheep in the Big City, Clifford the Big Red Dog
  • 2001 – Shrek (which wins the first ever Academy Award for Best Animated Feature), The Fairly OddParents, Monsters, Inc., Spirited Away, The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy, Samurai Jack, Invader Zim, Time Squad, El Nombre, Justice League, Teamo Supremo, Yu-Gi-Oh!, The Proud Family, Atlantis: The Lost Empire, House of Mouse, Stanley, Totally Spies!, Beyblade; Gorillaz release their self-titled debut album
  • 2002 – Lilo & Stitch, The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius, Ice Age, Whatever Happened to... Robot Jones?, The Cat Returns, A Town Called Panic (TV series), Filmore!, Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron, ChalkZone, ¡Mucha Lucha!, Mr. Bean: The Animated Series, Kim Possible, Treasure Planet, The ChubbChubbs!, Codename: Kids Next Door; Sony Pictures Animation is founded
  • 2003 – Finding Nemo, Teen Titans, The Triplets of Belleville, Boundin', Xiaolin Showdown, My Life as a Teenage Robot, Brother Bear, Creature Comforts (TV series), The Venture Bros., Lilo & Stitch: The Series, Harvie Krumpet, Sonic X, Jojo's Circus, Code Lyoko, All Grown Up!
  • 2004 – Foster's Home For Imaginary Friends, The Incredibles, Drawn Together, Shrek 2, The Polar Express, Franny's Feet, Bleach, Atomic Betty, Peppa Pig, Hi Hi Puffy AmiYumi, Danny Phantom, The Backyardigans, Dave the Barbarian, Super Robot Monkey Team Hyperforce Go!, Winx Club, Brandy and Mr. Whiskers, Howl's Moving Castle, Higglytown Heroes, W.I.T.C.H.
  • 2005 – Avatar: The Last Airbender, Ben 10, Wallace and Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit, Corpse Bride, American Dad!, Robot Chicken, Madagascar, 9, The Boondocks, Go, Diego, Go!, Camp Lazlo, Harry and His Bucket Full of Dinosaurs, Squidbillies, Pleasant Goat and Big Big Wolf, Little Einsteins, Gerald McBoing Boing, The Life and Times of Juniper Lee, American Dragon: Jake Long, Johnny Test, The Buzz on Maggie; Gorillaz release Demon Days; Laika is founded
  • 2006 – Happy Feet, Curious George, Yin Yang Yo!, Mickey Mouse Clubhouse, Wow! Wow! Wubbzy!, Cars, Handy Manny, Monster House, Wonder Pets!, Flushed Away, Horrid Henry, Class of 3000, My Gym Partner's A Monkey, Pucca, Over the Hedge, Peter and the Wolf, Lifted, The Replacements, The Secret Show
  • 2007 – Phineas and Ferb, Ratatouille, Chowder, Persepolis, Surf's Up, WordGirl, The Simpsons Movie, El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera, Meet the Robinsons, Beowulf, Back at the Barnyard, Shaun the Sheep, Ni Hao, Kai-Lan; Chris Meledandri leaves 20th Century Fox Animation to form his own company Illumination
  • 2008 – Kung Fu Panda, Ponyo, Total Drama, Star Wars: The Clone Wars, WALL-E, The Marvelous Misadventures of Flapjack, 3rd and Bird, Ben 10: Alien Force, Random! Cartoons, Waltz with Bashir, Presto, The Mighty B, The Secret Saturdays, Batman: The Brave and the Bold, Sid the Science Kid, Tinker Bell, Bolt, Simon's Cat, Dr. Seuss' Horton Hears a Who!, Martha Speaks, The Penguins of Madagascar
  • 2009 – Coraline, Mary and Max, Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs, Up, Masha and the Bear, Fanboy & Chum Chum, Prep & Landing, Archer, The Cleveland Show, A Town Called Panic (film), The Secret of Kells, My Dog Tulip, The Princess and the Frog, Fantastic Mr. Fox, Monsters vs. Aliens, Special Agent Oso, The Gruffalo

2010s[edit]

  • 2010 – Despicable Me, My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, Toy Story 3, Adventure Time, The Ricky Gervais Show, Tangled, How to Train Your Dragon, T.U.F.F. Puppy, Octonauts, Generator Rex, Chico and Rita, Team Umizoomi, Regular Show, Young Justice, The Illusionist, Day & Night, Arrietty, Megamind, Ben 10: Ultimate Alien; Gorillaz release Plastic Beach
  • 2011 – Bob's Burgers, The Adventures of Tintin, The Amazing World of Gumball, Jake and the Neverland Pirates, Arthur Christmas, Rango, A Cat in Paris, The Looney Tunes Show, La Luna, Rio, Rastamouse, Puss in Boots, DC Nation Shorts, Gnomeo and Juliet, Bubble Guppies, Larva, Almost Naked Animals, A Monster in Paris, From Up on Poppy Hill, Kung Fu Panda 2, The Fantastic Flying Books of Mr. Morris Lessmore
  • 2012 – The Legend of Korra, Brave, Gravity Falls, Ben 10: Omniverse, Wreck-It Ralph, ParaNorman, Hotel Transylvania, Frankenweenie, Doc McStuffins, The Pirates! In an Adventure with Scientists, Rise of the Guardians, Bravest Warriors, Green Lantern: The Animated Series, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2012), Sofia the First, Daniel Tiger's Neighbourhood, Paperman, DreamWorks Dragons, Littlest Pet Shop, Om Nom Stories
  • 2013 – Frozen, Rick and Morty, Mickey Mouse, The Wind Rises, Turbo, Steven Universe, Turbo FAST (which debuts on Netflix rather than cable or commercial TV), The Croods, Teen Titans Go!, Despicable Me 2, Angry Birds Toons, The Tale of Princess Kaguya, Epic, PAW Patrol, Sheriff Callie's Wild West
  • 2014 – The Book of Life, The Lego Movie, Over the Garden Wall, Big Hero 6, Clarence, How to Train Your Dragon 2, Elf: Buddy's Musical Christmas, Star Wars Rebels, When Marnie Was There, Mixels, Sonic Boom, Dora and Friends: Into the City!, Mr. Pickles, BoJack Horseman, Song of the Sea, The Boxtrolls, Bing, Blaze and the Monster Machines
  • 2015 – Inside Out, Shaun the Sheep Movie, The Peanuts Movie, Dinotrux, Star vs. the Forces of Evil, Danger Mouse (2015), Sanjay's Super Team, Home, Minions, Mighty Magiswords, The Good Dinosaur, Dinotrux, Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir, We Bare Bears, The Mr. Peabody and Sherman Show, Harvey Beaks, Shimmer and Shine, Anomalisa, Talking Tom and Friends, The Little Prince
  • 2016 – Zootopia, Finding Dory, Sausage Party, Moana, The Secret Life of Pets, Milo Murphy's Law, The Loud House, Trolls, Kung Fu Panda 3, Tales of Arcadia, Kubo and the Two Strings, Sing, Elena of Avalor, The Red Turtle, Piper, My Life as a Courgette, Voltron: Legendary Defender
  • 2017 – Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie, DuckTales (2017), Castlevania, The Breadwinner, Coco, The Lego Batman Movie, Lucas the Spider, Unikitty!, Welcome to the Wayne, OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes, Ferdinand, In a Heartbeat, Big Mouth, Big Hero 6: The Series, The Big Bad Fox and Other Tales..., Tangled: The Series, Star Wars: Forces of Destiny, Mary and the Witch's Flower, Loving Vincent, Hanazuki: Full of Treasures
  • 2018 – Isle of Dogs, Final Space, Incredibles 2, DC Super Hero Girls, Early Man, Summer Camp Island, Smallfoot, Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse, Craig of the Creek, Dr. Seuss' The Grinch, Ralph Breaks the Internet, Let's Go Luna!, Close Enough
  • 2019 – Infinity Train, Frozen 2, How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World, Toy Story 4, Wonder Park, Spies in Disguise, The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part, Missing Link, Farmageddon: A Shaun the Sheep Movie

2020s[edit]

  • 2020 – Ron's Gone Wrong, The Croods 2, Nimona, Scooby, Vivo
  • 2021 – Foster
